Uses of Class
android.app.Dialog

Packages that use Dialog
android.app High-level classes encapsulating the overall Android application model. 
android.inputmethodservice Base classes for writing input methods. 
android.preference Provides classes that manage application preferences and implement the preferences UI. 
android.text.method Provides classes that monitor or modify keypad input. 
 

Uses of Dialog in android.app
 

Subclasses of Dialog in android.app
 class AlertDialog
          A subclass of Dialog that can display one, two or three buttons.
 class DatePickerDialog
          A simple dialog containing an DatePicker.
 class ProgressDialog
          A dialog showing a progress indicator and an optional text message or view.
 class SearchDialog
          In-application-process implementation of Search Bar.
 class TimePickerDialog
          A dialog that prompts the user for the time of day using a TimePicker.
 

Methods in android.app that return Dialog
protected  Dialog Activity.onCreateDialog(int id)
          Callback for creating dialogs that are managed (saved and restored) for you by the activity.
 

Methods in android.app with parameters of type Dialog
protected  void Activity.onPrepareDialog(int id, Dialog dialog)
          Provides an opportunity to prepare a managed dialog before it is being shown.

Subclasses of Dialog in android.inputmethodservice

          A SoftInputWindow is a Dialog that is intended to be used for a top-level input method window.
